title: "Workgroup 5: Multiple Regression with R"
date: 24/11/2025

In this session we will examine how to execute and interpret multiple linear regression models.

As described in the lecture, multiple linera regression allows us to create models to predict a continuous outcome using **two or more predictors (categorical or continuous)** or in the case of a **single categorical predictor with more** **than two levels.**

We will look at examples of models with a combination of categorical and continuous predictor and the interpretation of its coefficients in each of the cases.

# ðŸ§  Learning Objectives {.unnumbered}

By the end of this lesson, you will be able to:

-   Fit and interpret a multiple linear model with categorical and continuous predictors using `lm()` .

-   Understand concept of main effects and marginal means.

-   Visualize models with several predictors.

-   Perform post-hoc tests to evaluate the effects.

-   Report multiple linear model results.
